Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/global/mail_addr_find.c

1/* $NetBSD: mail_addr_find.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:45 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* mail_addr_find 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* generic address-based lookup
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include <mail_addr_find.h>
10/*
11/* const char *mail_addr_find(maps, address, extension)
12/* MAPS *maps;
13/* const char *address;
14/* char **extension;
15/* DESCRIPTION
16/* mail_addr_find() searches the specified maps for an entry with as
17/* key the specified address, and derivations from that address.
18/* It is up to the caller to specify its case sensitivity
19/* preferences when it opens the maps.
20/* The result is overwritten upon each call.
21/*
22/* An address that is in the form \fIuser\fR matches itself.
23/*
24/* Given an address of the form \fIuser@domain\fR, the following
25/* lookups are done in the given order until one returns a result:
26/* .IP user@domain
27/* Look up the entire address.
28/* .IP user
29/* Look up \fIuser\fR when \fIdomain\fR is equal to $myorigin,
30/* when \fIdomain\fR matches $mydestination, or when it matches
31/* $inet_interfaces or $proxy_interfaces.
32/* .IP @domain
33/* Look for an entry that matches the domain specified in \fIaddress\fR.
34/* .PP
35/* With address extension enabled, the table lookup order is:
36/* \fIuser+extension\fR@\fIdomain\fR, \fIuser\fR@\fIdomain\fR,
37/* \fIuser+extension\fR, \fIuser\fR, and @\fIdomain\fR.
38/* .PP
39/* Arguments:
40/* .IP maps
41/* Dictionary search path (see maps(3)).
42/* .IP address
43/* The address to be looked up.
44/* .IP extension
45/* A null pointer, or the address of a pointer that is set to
46/* the address of a dynamic memory copy of the address extension
47/* that had to be chopped off in order to match the lookup tables.
48/* The copy includes the recipient address delimiter.
49/* The caller is expected to pass the copy to myfree().
50/* DIAGNOSTICS
51/* The maps->error value is non-zero when the lookup
52/* should be tried again.
53/* SEE ALSO
54/* maps(3), multi-dictionary search
55/* resolve_local(3), recognize local system
56/* LICENSE
57/* .ad
58/* .fi
59/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
60/* AUTHOR(S)
61/* Wietse Venema
62/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
63/* P.O. Box 704
64/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
65/*--*/
66
67/* System library. */
68
69#include <sys_defs.h>
70#include <string.h>
71
72/* Utility library. */
73
74#include <msg.h>
75#include <dict.h>
76#include <stringops.h>
77#include <mymalloc.h>
78#include <vstring.h>
79
80/* Global library. */
81
82#include <mail_params.h>
83#include <strip_addr.h>
84#include <mail_addr_find.h>
85#include <resolve_local.h>
86
87/* Application-specific. */
88
89#define STR vstring_str
90
91/* mail_addr_find - map a canonical address */
92
93const char *mail_addr_find(MAPS *path, const char *address, char **extp)
94{
95 const char *myname = "mail_addr_find";
96 const char *result;
97 char *ratsign = 0;
98 char *full_key;
99 char *bare_key;
100 char *saved_ext;
101 int rc = 0;
102
103 /*
104 * Initialize.
105 */
106 full_key = mystrdup(address);
107 if (*var_rcpt_delim == 0) {
108 bare_key = saved_ext = 0;
109 } else {
110 bare_key = strip_addr(full_key, &saved_ext, var_rcpt_delim);
111 }
112
113 /*
114 * Try user+foo@domain and user@domain.
115 *
116 * Specify what keys are partial or full, to avoid matching partial
117 * addresses with regular expressions.
118 */
119#define FULL 0
120#define PARTIAL DICT_FLAG_FIXED
121
122 if ((result = maps_find(path, full_key, FULL)) == 0 && path->error == 0
123 && bare_key != 0 && (result = maps_find(path, bare_key, PARTIAL)) != 0
124 && extp != 0) {
125 *extp = saved_ext;
126 saved_ext = 0;
127 }
128
129 /*
130 * Try user+foo@$myorigin, user+foo@$mydestination or
131 * user+foo@[${proxy,inet}_interfaces]. Then try with +foo stripped off.
132 */
133 if (result == 0 && path->error == 0
134 && (ratsign = strrchr(full_key, '@')) != 0
135 && (strcasecmp_utf8(ratsign + 1, var_myorigin) == 0
136 || (rc = resolve_local(ratsign + 1)) > 0)) {
137 *ratsign = 0;
138 result = maps_find(path, full_key, PARTIAL);
139 if (result == 0 && path->error == 0 && bare_key != 0) {
140 if ((ratsign = strrchr(bare_key, '@')) == 0)
141 msg_panic("%s: bare key botch", myname);
142 *ratsign = 0;
143 if ((result = maps_find(path, bare_key, PARTIAL)) != 0 && extp != 0) {
144 *extp = saved_ext;
145 saved_ext = 0;
146 }
147 }
148 *ratsign = '@';
149 } else if (rc < 0)
150 path->error = rc;
151
152 /*
153 * Try @domain.
154 */
155 if (result == 0 && path->error == 0 && ratsign)
156 result = maps_find(path, ratsign, PARTIAL);
157
158 /*
159 * Clean up.
160 */
161 if (msg_verbose)
162 msg_info("%s: %s -> %s", myname, address,
163 result ? result :
164 path->error ? "(try again)" :
165 "(not found)");
166 myfree(full_key);
167 if (bare_key)
168 myfree(bare_key);
169 if (saved_ext)
170 myfree(saved_ext);
171
172 return (result);
173}
174
175#ifdef TEST
176
177 /*
178 * Proof-of-concept test program. Read an address from stdin, and spit out
179 * the lookup result.
180 */
181#include <vstream.h>
182#include <vstring_vstream.h>
183#include <mail_conf.h>
184
185int main(int argc, char **argv)
186{
187 VSTRING *buffer = vstring_alloc(100);
188 MAPS *path;
189 const char *result;
190 char *extent;
191
192 /*
193 * Parse JCL.
194 */
195 if (argc != 2)
196 msg_fatal("usage: %s database", argv[0]);
197 msg_verbose = 1;
198
199 /*
200 * Initialize.
201 */
202 mail_conf_read();
203 path = maps_create(argv[0], argv[1], DICT_FLAG_LOCK | DICT_FLAG_FOLD_FIX \
204 |DICT_FLAG_UTF8_REQUEST);
205 while (vstring_fgets_nonl(buffer, VSTREAM_IN)) {
206 extent = 0;
207 result = mail_addr_find(path, STR(buffer), &extent);
208 vstream_printf("%s -> %s (%s)\n", STR(buffer), result ? result :
209 path->error ? "(try again)" :
210 "(not found)", extent ? extent : "null extension");
211 vstream_fflush(VSTREAM_OUT);
212 if (extent)
213 myfree(extent);
214 }
215 vstring_free(buffer);
216
217 maps_free(path);
218 return (0);
219}
220
221#endif
222
